page.title: 03Nanjizel House, St. Levan
page.content: Nanjizel house is the only building in this Domeday Block. It was built about the turn of the century for a member of the St. Aubyn family, the major landowners in St. Levan, as a holiday home. Eventually it became part of Bosistow Farm and was eventually sold into private ownership. For much of its time Nanjizel House has remained empty; difficulty of access over two kilometres of unmade track has meant it has not been popular as a family home. However in recent years it has been used by a family home as well as a base for a furniture restoring business at this time. The present owner is an American lady who has extended and modernised the house considerably, but only spends a few months each year living there. It has come full circle as a holiday home for a wealthy person.
